headline: Should GLP-1 Consumption Shifts and Wellness Trends Reshape PepsiCo’s (PEP) Long-Term Earnings Narrative?
summary: Earlier this week, Piper Sandler reiterated its positive view on PepsiCo but trimmed its outlook after the company reported modest 1.3% organic sales growth and a 2% decline in adjusted earnings per share in the third quarter amid weaker volumes and consumer pushback on higher prices. The brokerage flagged emerging headwinds from GLP-1-related consumption changes, input cost and tariff pressures, and PepsiCo’s need to lean harder into innovation and healthier, wellness-focused products while...
